function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inclusion of a recession dummy to control for business cycles","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pandemic-induced uncertainty leading to increased incentives for automation","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Health risks and reduced labor productivity due to social distancing measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential cyber viruses affecting robots","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global value chains dependent on cross-border capital flows","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of robots increasing due to pandemics","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Pandemics affecting robot adoption in industries","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate control of global business risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inequality in income and wage distribution","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pandemic events sars, h1n1, mers, ebola","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data collection from multiple sources may lead to inaccuracies and inconsistencies in the data.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The covid-19 pandemic has reshaped the nature of work, leading to changes in employment structures and job distribution.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pandemics leading to persistent increases in inequality","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Acceleration in robotization due to pandemics","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contribution of automation to the growing skill premium and rising inequality","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Industries with higher automation face lower risk of contagion, leading to lower exposure to lockdown-related risks.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Jobless recoveries are documented after large negative shocks like recessions and pandemics, leading to slow employment recovery.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global financial crises and pandemics accelerate routine-biased technological change, leading to slow job recovery and increased inequality.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Layoffs have been higher in industries that can be automated, increasing the risk of permanent job losses during the recovery.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in robot adoption after pandemics","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High robot density leading to increased inequality","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Acceleration of automation and robotization driving inequality","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Acceleration of automation and robotization","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of personal protective measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Simplified model assumptions may not be generalizable across all settings","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglect of factors that can negatively impact the efficacy of vector control, such as insecticide resistance and improper choice of insecticide","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Neglect of seasonal fluctuation in mosquito biting habits, leading to inaccurate representations of disease messages.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in outbreak timing across patches","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of personal protection measures without local vector control","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of concern for disease and concern for bites on disease burden","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Individuals reassessing their use of personal protection based on concern for disease and being bitten","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Semi-arbitrary choice of 2 days for length of time in the protected class","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Utilizing the parameter for distribution of susceptible individuals between protected and unprotected classes to adjust initial conditions","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High community-level control","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Low community-level control of vector spread","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases through human mobility","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Limited carrying capacity for mosquito larvae in each patch","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mosquito-borne virus transmission through human-mosquito
